page.title: 19New By_pass - A467
page.content: The northern section follows the west bank of the Ebbw and Sirhowy to Wattsville and the old Risca Colliery, crossing both rivers to rejoin the existing A467 at Crosskeys. Work began in February 1984 and is scheduled to finish in 1986. 4 kms. of dual carriageway link Pontymister to Watts- ville, with a 1.5km single carriageway from there to Crosskeys. 60% of the Â£10 million cost is for structural works. These include a 600 m. rein- forced earth wall, 3 underpasses, 5 reinforced concrete retaining walls and 3 large road bridges. The Ebbw has had to be realigned and a rock cutting of 19 m. max. made in Dolomitic Limestone near Blackvein. Shale is being taken from Blackvein Tips - which will later be landscaped - and limestone from Dan y Graig Quarry - which is to become a refuse tip.
